jobTitle: Clinical Research Scientist - Center for Rehabilitation Outcomes Research, Full-time
jobDescription: General Summary The Clinical Research Scientist will direct, manage, and administer various aspects of clinical or translational research in the creation and operation of a program of research focusing on evidence in the rehabilitation clinical realm. Teaches and advises therapists, nurses, and researchers in areas of clinical research. Provides specialized consultation to RIC investigators, clinical fellows and clinicians in the areas of evidence-based clinical research in area of specialty.  The Clinical Research Scientist will consistently demonstrate support of the Shirley Ryan AbilityLab statement of Vision, Mission and Core Values by striving for excellence, contributing to the team efforts and showing respect and compassion for patients and their families, fellow employees, and all others with whom there is contact at or in the interest of the institute.  The Clinical Research Scientist will demonstrate Shirley Ryan AbilityLab Core Attributes: Communication, Accountability, Flexibility/Adaptability, Judgment/Problem Solving, Customer Service and Core Values (Hope, Compassion, Discovery, Collaboration, & Commitment to Excellence) while fulfilling job duties.
